text:
Sorry I did not find the correct place for feature request, so I put this here.

I would like to have a static method in the
org.apache.log4j.Logger class called getLogger() that takes no parameter.

The Logger returned by the method should use the fully qualified class name of 
the caller.

For none static methods there is a workaround to call
Logger.getLogger(this.getClass), but I can't do that within static methods

In class A, you can do 
private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(A.class);

You can also use reflection if you like.  Or stick with initializing the logger 
in a constructor, where the non-static getClass() method is available as you've 
noted.

Other than that, your request will not be done, so I'm closing this item.  If 
you'd like to discuss it further, please do so on the log4j-user mailing list 
INSTEAD of simply reopening this Bugzilla issue.  Thank you.
